item.title: Federal Aviation Administration Fair Labor Management Dispute Resolution Act of 2006

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Aviation.

item.text: Motion to Discharge Committee filed by Mr. Costello. Petition No: 109-13. (Discharge petition text with signatures.)
Referred to the House Committee on Rules.

On 5/23/2006, a motion was filed to discharge the Rules Committee from consideration of H.Res.814 a resolution providing for the consideration of H.R.4755. A discharge petition requires 218 signatures for further action. (Discharge Petition No. 109-13: text with signatures.)

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4755) to amend title 49, United States Code, to modify the mediation and implementation requirements of section 40122 regarding changes in the Federal Aviation Administration personnel management system.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4755) to amend title 49, United States Code, to modify the mediation and implementation requirements of section 40122 regarding changes in the Federal Aviation Administration personnel management system, and for other purposes.

item.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4755) to amend title 49, United States Code, to modify the mediation and implementation requirements of section 40122 regarding changes in the Federal Aviation Administration personnel management system, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
